list_definition.definition: to squash by squeezing together etc

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The car was crushed between the two trucks.
We (were) all crushed into the tiny room.
There’s always a crush in the supermarket on Saturdays.

list_definition.definition: a strong feeling of romantic love for someone, especially by a young person for someone older, which does not usually last for a long time; infatuation

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: She had a huge crush on her French teacher

list_ex_of_english: After removing the leaves, stalks, etc., the grapes were crushed by hand to prevent the breakage of the seeds.
The oak galls are collected, crushed and either boiled or infused in rainwater (or white-wine vinegar).
Cattle were provided with water and crushed palm oil kernel when grass was unavailable.
They were then maintained in miracidia-free conditions for a period of 5 weeks prior to crushing to ascertain whether they had acquired infection.
The teeth are typically of crushing type with a finely punctuated occlusal face.
They are simply dull, with the smooth banality of the prose crushing the life out of the material.
